Meralco Reference Number must be 26 digits
Service ID Number must be 12 digits
Amount Due must be greater than 0.00
Account Number must be 8 or 10 digits
Telephone Number must be 7 to 10 digits
Amount Due must be greater than or equal to 20.00
Contact Number must not be greater than 12 digits

Meter Number must not be greater than 15 alphanumeric characters.
Last Name must not be greater than 20 characters.

I agree on the Terms of Service and on the Data Privacy Policy
We have updated our Bayad Connect. You may now view our Data Privacy Policy in accordance with Republic Act 10173, otherwise known as the Data Privacy Act of 2012.

CIS Bayad Center, Inc. ("Bayad Center") recognizes its responsibilities under Republic Act No. 10173, also known as the Data Privacy Act of 2012 and is committed to safeguarding your Personal Information. 

 Coverage
 Your Personal Information is needed to register to our mobile app which at the minimum includes your full name, address, email and contact number. Your Personal Information is further required by the billing company or government agency in processing your payments through the Bayad Center system. This includes your full name, account number, date of birth, address, contact number and Government ID details (as applicable). 

 Data Gathering and Usage
 we collect your personal information mainly to verify your identity and ensure that your payment details are accurate. Your payment data is encoded through our secured payment system and is subsequently uploaded to your biller company for the proper posting of your payment/s. 


Furthermore, your information may and shall only be used for the following purposes:
 • Payment history inquiry;
 • Bayad Center promotions, rewards and customer loyalty programs;
 • Bayad Center advisories and updates;
 • Credit-scoring purposes upon customer's request;


Bayad Center shall not disclose your personal information to third parties without your consent unless such disclosure or data sharing is required by applicable laws necessary to the said purposes. 

 Data Retention
 Your registered Personal Information and your payment information will be stored in our database. Bayad Center has established appropriate organizational, physical and technical security measures to ensure the protection of your personal information. 

 Customer's Consent and Declaration
 The Personal and Payment Information that I will provide will be made in good faith, verified correct to the best of my knowledge, pursuant to any Laws and Regulations applicable. I fully understand that CIS BAYAD CENTER, INC. is authorized to accept and process payments and documents submitted through its mobile app. 

 Furthermore, I have read Bayad Center's Data Privacy Statement and voluntarily and freely provide my consent for Bayad Center to collect, encode, transmit, process, analyze, retrieve, update or modify my personal data for registration to Bayad Center's online portal and processing of my bills payment. I also affirm my rights to (a) be informed, (b) access, (c) object, (d) ensure erasure of blocking, (e) damages, (f) file a complaint, (g) rectify, and (h) data portability.

resources.string: Any individual or entity (\'You\') accessing or using the Bayad Connect Mobile Application ("Service") from within the Philippines shall be deemed to have entered with CIS BAYAD CENTER, INC., (CBCI) into this arrangement that is governed by this Bayad Connect Mobile Application Terms of Use (\'Terms\').\n\nPLEASE READ THESE TERMS CAREFULLY BEFORE ACCESSING OR USING THE SERVICE as it provides the rights and obligations pertaining to its use. If You do not agree to be bound by all of these Terms, do not access or use the Service.

a. Bayad Connect – is an application powered by Bayad Center that enables its user to pay bills and transact other services of CIS Bayad Center Inc. that is included in the application 

b. Online Bills Payment Service - A type of service that CIS Bayad Center Inc. that enables Bills Payment Acceptance using Online Channels such us web, mobile applications and other 

c. TPA ID – A unique ID provided as a login and an identifier of the Agent in which the transactions are tracked and processed under the assigned ID


d. Digital Wallet – A wallet of an Agent that allows an individual to make electronic transactions. This enables agents in accepting bills payment on-line with a computer or using a smartphone to pay for the bill and other services included CIS Bayad Center Inc. Replenishment of the wallet is thru enabled partners. 

e. Balance – Indicates the remaining balance of your Digital Wallet 

f. Bill Category – Category of what type of bills are available in the application or service 

g. Billers – List of billers that can be paid in the application or service 

h. Today's Bill – Indicates the total number of bills paid within the day 

i. Month's Bill – Indicates the total number of bills paid within the month 

j. Today's Sale – Indicates the total amount collected within the day 

k. Total Income – Total amount of revenue generated 

l. Transaction Summary – Indicates the date, number of transactions, sale and income 

m. Transaction Number – A series of number that helps identify a specific transaction
The use of the words \u0027including\u0027 and \u0027include\u0027 shall mean \u0027including, but not limited to\u0027 unless otherwise explicitly provided.

Your use of the Service shall be governed by the provisions herein. These Terms expressly supersede prior agreements or arrangements with you with respect to the Service. You agree that CBCI, may, at its discretion, immediately terminate the Service or deny access to the Service or any portion thereof, at any time and for any reason without prior notice. 

CBCI may amend the Terms related to the Service from time to time. Any and all amendments shall be effective upon CBCI's posting of such updated Terms. Your continued access or use of the Service after the amendment signifies your consent to be bound by the Terms, as amended. 

Misuse of our Online Bills Payment Service or unauthorized access thereto, shall justify suspension or termination of your account. 

Using our service do not give you ownership of any intellectual property rights. These terms do not grant you the removal or alteration of the branding BAYAD CONNECT BILLS PAY. 

In connection with your use of the service, we may send you service announcements, administrative messages and other information. You may however opt out of some of those communications.

Access and Use of the Service. 
CBCI grants you a limited, non-exclusive, revocable and non-transferable right to access and use the Service on your personal device solely for your personal and non-commercial use. You agree not to use the Service for any other purpose that is or may be construed as inconsistent herewith. Any rights not expressly granted herein are reserved by CBCI and its licensors. 

Restrictions.
You shall not: (i) remove any copyright, trademark or other proprietary notices from any portion of the Service; (ii) reproduce, modify, prepare derivative works based thereon, distribute, license, lease, sell, resell, transfer, publicly display, publicly perform, transmit, stream, broadcast or otherwise exploit the Service except as expressly permitted by CBCI; (iii) decompile, reverse engineer or disassemble the Service except as may be permitted by applicable law; (iv) cause or launch any programs or scripts for the purpose of scraping, indexing, surveying, or otherwise data mining any portion of the Service or unduly burdening or hindering the operation and/or functionality of any aspect of the Service; (v) attempt to gain unauthorized access to or impair any aspect of the Service or its related systems or networks; or (vi) do any and all other actions inconsistent with these Terms and the fair use of the Service. 

Third-Party Service and Content. 
The Service may be made available or accessed in connection with third-party services and content (including advertising) outside of CBCIs' control. You acknowledge that different terms of use and privacy policies may apply to your use of such third-party services and content. CBCI does not endorse such third party services and content and in no event shall CBCI be responsible or liable for any products or services of such third party providers to you. It is understood that Apple Inc. and Google, Inc. are third-party beneficiaries herein, in case you decide to access the Service using Apple iOS or Android-powered mobile devices, respectively. These third-party beneficiaries are not parties to these Terms and are not responsible for the provision or support of the Service to You, in any manner. Your access to Apple, Inc. and Google, Inc. will be governed by the applicable terms of service. 

Ownership. 
The Service and all rights therein are and shall remain to be CBCI's property or those of its licensors. Neither these Terms nor your use of the Service will convey or grant any rights in your favor: (i) in or related to the Service except for the limited rights granted herein; or (ii) to use or make reference in any manner to CBCI's company names, logos, products and service names, trademarks or service marks or those of its licensor.

4.1 CUT-OFF TIME: The cut-off time for bill payments is at 8pm Philippine Standard Time. If you are not paying within the Philippines, it is your responsibility to ensure that any payments shall be made within the time indicated herein to be included in the cut-off. 

4.2 NO REVERSALS: You will be issued a reference number confirming receipt by CBCI of your payment. Your receipt of the reference number signifies that payment has been completed and will be credited to your account. CBCI shall send an email confirmation of all payments made, which information will be stored in your Account History. 

4.3 POSTING: All payments made after the cut-off shall be \u0027posted\u0027 to CBCI Partner Billers within 24 hours or 1 business day. 

4.4 VERIFICATION: All payments made may be verified directly with the Service partner. 

4.5 User Accounts. Only users who are eighteen (18) years old and above are allowed to avail of and use the Service. You warrant, by accepting the Terms hereof, that you have the legal capacity to avail of our Service. Before You begin, You will be asked to register and create your Service Account (\u0027Account\u0027) and you hereby consent to provide CBCI truthfully the following personal information: name, address, email address, mobile phone number and age, and your banking information for purposes of payment. You expressly agree and consent to the collection, processing, disclosure and transfer of any personal information that you provide to CBCI under these Terms, and that you have read and understood and agree to CBCI's service policy found at https://domestic.bayadcenteronline.com/page/using-our-service. Further, You agree to maintain accurate, complete, and up-to-date information in your Account and your failure to do so may result in your inability to access and use the Service or of its termination. You take sole responsibility for all the activities undertaken in your Account. You are responsible for the use of your Account username and password at all times. Unless otherwise permitted by CBCI in writing, You cannot create more than one Account. 

4.6 User Requirements and Conduct. You shall not authorize third parties to use your Account, and you may not assign or otherwise transfer your Account to any other person or entity. You agree to comply with all applicable laws of the Philippines in connection with the use of the Service, and you shall only use the Service for lawful purposes. In certain instances, such as when your account has been compromised, CBCI may require you to provide proof of identity to retrieve access of your account for the continued use of the Service. Your failure to provide the required proof of identity shall result to the denial of your access to use the Service. 

You expressly agree to furnish CBCI with pertinent information, such as but not limited to your first and last name, email address, mailing address, and phone number (each of the foregoing, \u0027Contact Information\u0027) and all other information that may be required. 

You hereby represent and warrant that (i) you have obtained the requisite consent required under applicable law directly from each individual of whom you are sharing Contact Information; (ii) you have any other rights, licenses, consents and releases required under applicable law to share Contact Information with CBCI, including, without limitation, consents required under Republic Act No. 10173 or the Data Privacy Act of 2012; (iii) you are of legal age (iv) your sharing of Contact Information will not infringe, misappropriate, or violate a third party's proprietary rights, or rights of publicity or privacy, or obligations of confidentiality, or result in any violation of any applicable law or regulation; and (v) the Contact Information shall be accurate and not misleading. 

You understand and agree that CBCI may, in its sole discretion, terminate your access to the Service or withhold or cancel payment of any referral award amounts payable to You under these Terms in the event of (a) any actual or suspected fraudulent activity by You or in relation to your use of the Service; (b) any actual or suspected violation of applicable law by You or in relation to your use of the Service, or (c) any actual or suspected violation of the Terms provided herein. 

4.7 User Provided Content. CBCI allows You to submit, upload, publish or otherwise make available to CBCI through the Service textual, audio, and/or visual content and information, including commentary and feedback related to the Service (\u0027User Content\u0027). Any User Content furnished to us remains to be your property, however, You expressly authorize and grant CBCI a worldwide, perpetual, irrevocable, transferrable, right to use, copy, modify, create derivative works of, distribute, publicly display, publicly perform, and otherwise exploit in any manner such User Content in all formats and distribution channels now known or hereafter devised (including in connection with the Service and CBCI's business and on third-party sites and services), without further notice to or consent from You, and without any monetary compensation to You or any other person or entity. 

In this regard, You represent and warrant that: (i) You are the sole and exclusive owner of all User Content or You have all the pertinent rights, licenses, consents and releases necessary to grant CBCI the rights to use the User Content as set forth above; and (ii) neither the User Content nor your submission, uploading, publishing or otherwise making available of such User Content nor CBCIs' use of the User Content as permitted herein will infringe, misappropriate or violate a third party's intellectual property or proprietary rights, or rights of publicity or privacy, or result in the violation of any applicable law or regulation. 

You further agree not to provide any User Content that is defamatory, libelous, hateful, violent, obscene, pornographic, unlawful, or otherwise offensive, whether or not such material may be protected by law. CBCI may, but shall not be obligated to, review, monitor, or remove User Content, at CBCIs' sole discretion and at any time and for any reason, without any prior notice. 

4.8 Network Access and Devices. You are responsible for obtaining the data network access necessary to use the Service. You are aware that you may incur charges in the use of your data network as may be imposed by your carrier provider. You are responsible for acquiring and updating compatible hardware or devices necessary to access and use the Service and any updates thereto. CBCI does not guarantee that the Service, or any portion thereof, will function on any particular hardware or devices. In addition, the Service may be subject to malfunctions and delays inherent in the use of the Internet and electronic communications. 

4.9 Text Messaging. By creating an Account, you agree and expressly consent to receive informational text messages (by way of SMS) as part of the normal operations of the use of the Service. You are aware and hereby acknowledge that opting out of receiving text (SMS) messages may impact your use of the Services.

As a user of the Service, you are eligible to receive payment by way of a referral award (\\u0027Award\\u0027) from CBCI for successful referrals made. Your eligibility to receive the Award is subject to the terms and conditions set forth in the Service to be qualified to receive the Award, You should successfully refer Agent Partners who are new partners to CBCI\'S platform. CBCI shall not be responsible for any referral awards not credited to your account due to your failure to provide us with accurate Account information, including, without limitation, banking information.

6.1 DISCLAIMER.
 THE SERVICE IS PROVIDED 'AS IS' AND 'AS AVAILABLE.' CBCI DISCLAIMS, TO THE MAXIMUM EXTENT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW, ALL REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES, EXPRESS, IMPLIED, OR STATUTORY, NOT EXPRESSLY SET OUT IN THESE TERMS, INCLUDING THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NON-INFRINGEMENT. IN ADDITION, CBCI MAKES NO REPRESENTATION, WARRANTY, OR GUARANTEE THAT THE SERVICE WILL BE UNINTERRUPTED OR ERROR-FREE. YOU AGREE TO ACCEPT ALL RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH THE USE OF THE SERVICE. THIS DISCLAIMER DOES NOT ALTER YOUR RIGHTS AS A CONSUMER TO THE EXTENT NOT PERMITTED BY APPLICABLE LAW. 

6.2 LIMITATION OF LIABILITY. 
CBCI SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR DIRECT OR INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, EXEMPLARY, PUNITIVE, OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOST PROFITS, LOST DATA, PERSONAL INJURY, OR PROPERTY DAMAGE RELATED TO, IN CONNECTION WITH, OR OTHERWISE RESULTING FROM ANY USE OF THE SERVICE, EVEN IF CBCI HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. CBCI, ITS DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, EMPLOYEES OR AGENTS SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY DAMAGES, LIABILITY OR LOSSES ARISING OUT OF YOUR USE OF OR RELIANCE ON THE SERVICE OR YOUR INABILITY TO ACCESS OR USE THE SERVICE. CBCI SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR DELAY OR FAILURE IN PERFORMANCE RESULTING FROM CAUSES BEYOND CBCI'S REASONABLE CONTROL. IN NO EVENT SHALL CBCI'S TOTAL LIABILITY TO YOU IN CONNECTION WITH THE SERVICE FOR ALL DAMAGES, LOSSES AND CAUSES OF ACTION. THESE LIMITATIONS DO NOT PURPORT TO LIMIT LIABILITY THAT CANNOT BE EXCLUDED UNDER APPLICABLE LAW. 

6.3 INDEMNITY. 
YOU AGREE TO INDEMNIFY AND HOLD CBCI AND ITS OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, EMPLOYEES AND AGENTS, HARMLESS FROM ANY AND ALL CLAIMS, DEMANDS, LOSSES, LIABILITIES, AND EXPENSES (INCLUDING ATTORNEYS' FEES), INCURRED ON ACCOUNT OF SUCH CLAIMS, SUIT, DAMAGE OR ACTION ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH: (I) YOUR USE OF THE SERVICE; (II) YOUR BREACH OR VIOLATION OF ANY OF THESE TERMS; (III) YOUR SHARING OF CONTACT INFORMATION WITH CBCI; (IV) CBCI'S USE OF CONTACT INFORMATION OR USER CONTENT; OR (V) YOUR VIOLATION OF THE RIGHTS OF ANY THIRD PARTY.

These Terms are governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the Philippines, excluding its rules on conflicts of laws. The Vienna Convention on the International Sale of Goods of 1980 (CISG) shall not apply. Any dispute, conflict or controversy, howsoever arising out of or broadly in connection with or relating to these Terms, including but not limited to those relating to its validity, its construction or its enforceability, shall be finally settled by arbitration in accordance with Philippine Dispute Resolution Center, Inc. (PDRCI) Rules. The arbitration shall be conducted in English by three (3) arbitrators in Metro Manila, Philippines, with each Party having the right to choose one (1) arbitrator each and with the third (3rd) arbitration to be chosen by PDRCI. The arbitration proceedings, including all records, documents, pleadings, orders and judgments filed or rendered in pursuant thereto, shall be kept confidential. \n\nIn all cases where unilateral termination is allowed under this Terms, it is understood that prior resort to arbitration or any judicial, administrative or other governmental action shall not be required for purposes of exercising said right. The parties waive any right to insist on prior resort to arbitration or such other action to the fullest extent allowed under applicable law. In the event either party disputes or questions the exercise by the other of the right to unilaterally terminate this Terms, it is agreed that pending the determination of the issue of whether this Terms may be terminated, the parties\' obligations under the Terms, except those which are intended to survive the termination or expiration of the Terms, shall be deemed suspended. It is further understood that the party who disputes the unilateral termination will shoulder all costs, including attorney\'s fees, should the termination be found to be proper.

8.1 Notice.
CBCI may give notice by means of a general notice on the Service, electronic mail to your email address in your account (if you have created an account), or by written communication sent by pre-paid post or courier to your address listed in your Account. Such notice shall be deemed to have been given upon the expiration of forty-eight (48) hours after mailing or posting (if sent by pre-paid post or courier) or twelve (12) hours after sending (if sent by email). You may give notice to CBCI, with such notice deemed given when received by CBCI, at any time by first class mail, pre-paid post or courier to CIS Bayad Center Inc., Attn: Digital and Online Operations – SIO, Business Solutions Center, Meralco Complex, Ortigas Avenue, 0300 Pasig, Philippines. 

8.2 Prohibition against Assignment.
This rights herein provided may not be assigned without CBCI’s prior written approval. CBCI may however assign this Terms without your consent to: (i) a subsidiary or affiliate or related party; (ii) an acquirer of CBCI’s equity, business or assets; or (iii) a successor by merger. Any purported assignment in violation of this section shall be void. No joint venture, partnership, employment, or agency relationship exists between You or CBCI as a result hereof. If any provision hereof is held to be invalid or unenforceable, such provision shall be invalidated and declared void but the remaining provisions shall be enforced to the fullest extent under law. Our failure to enforce any right or provision herein shall not constitute a waiver of such right or provision unless acknowledged and agreed to by CBCI in writing.
San Jose Del Monte Water District
Cagayan Electric Power And Light Co
